Package ascii_processing

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • ascii_processing.Shape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, CompositeShape, Line, Point, Polygon
    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
    Shape base class.

    Also contains classes and methods used for constructing shapes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      protected class  Shape.RelativePoints
      A Shape's x,y points.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(int[] newPosition)
        Modifies the Shape's position.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - new position

      • lineBetween

        protected static final java.util.ArrayList<int[]> lineBetween​(int[] point1,
                                                              int[] point2)
        Makes a line between 2 points.

        Has exactly one point for every x coordinate. Does not include the ending point.

        Parameters:
        point1 - starting point
        point2 - ending point
        Returns:
        the line between the points
        See Also:
        straightLine(int[], int[])

      • straightLine

        protected static final java.util.ArrayList<int[]> straightLine​(int[] point1,
                                                               int[] point2)
        Returns an ArrayList of the points on a vertical line.
        Parameters:
        point1 - starting point
        point2 - point with y coordinate to end by
        Returns:
        list of points on the vertical line
        See Also:
        lineBetween(int[], int[])

      • reversePoint

        protected static final int[] reversePoint​(int[] point)
        Makes a point with reversed coordinates.

        For example, (x,y) becomes (y,x).

        Parameters:
        point - 2D point
        Returns:
        reversed point
        See Also:
        Shape.RelativePoints.reversePoints()

      • fillBorder

        protected final void fillBorder​(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> border)
        Finds all points within a border.

        The border must be ordered sequentially.

        Parameters:
        border - list of points on a border
        See Also:
        Polygon.makeBorder(int[][])
